text:
Hey all — This post is old news but it seems to be getting some activity as of late on the forums so I thought id share it here. Upvote it if you have a use case for it!

TL;DR

Add feature to migrate pages/page content from one portal to another — similar to how you can easily port over templates.

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Moving-Pages-amp-Content-not-just-templates-Between-Portals/idi-p/305346>
as someone who has lived that waking nightmare, i just RAN to upvote it.
actually going to pass it on to my team and have them upvote it as well. because…. they were equally traumatized LOL

Hahaha I think its funny because I made this post back in 2019 and all of a sudden the past few weeks Ive gotten emails that it was upvoted and I totally forgot that I ever posted anything on there at all.

But yea. I can totally empathize with that. Ive had a handful of 1:1 migrations and getting all of the content over is the absolute WORST.
they’re all running to upvote it….. it was SUCH A TASK

partly because the person handling the english pages had to build them first, so the people handling the non-us locales could create their localizations off of it…… and it goes downhill from there. because content inevitably gets messy over the years, and then there’s the distraction of “should we fix this while--” NO. NO PLEASE GOD NO
client still has two portals, so i don’t trust that it never will happen again

on another subject (but everyone please go upvote BJ’s post above),

i’m importing a blog via CSV. it goes back almost 10 years (yes i know). Many of the old images have gone missing from the production server over the years. The import goes fine, but this (from a HubSpot server) is injected for every *missing* image.

It looks terrible! is there a way to have HubSpot NOT substitute its own graphic for missing import items?
